thread.title: Repsol to Sell $7.1 Billion of Noncore Assets in Cost-Cutting Drive
thread.title_full: Repsol to Sell $7.1 Billion of Noncore Assets in Cost-Cutting Drive - WSJ

author: David Román
title: Repsol to Sell $7.1 Billion of Noncore Assets in Cost-Cutting Drive
text:
MADRID—Repsol SA said Thursday it will sell €6.2 billion ($7.1 billion) worth of noncore assets through 2020 as part of a cost-cutting drive, which also includes a significant cut in oil-exploration spending.
The Spanish oil major said it would reduce capital expenditure by 38% from last year’s levels, as it presented a strategic plan covering the 2016-2020 period. The plan aims to keep shareholder returns stable in a scenario of contained oil prices and represents a significant shift in focus from growth toward increased...
